description.narrative:
Vodafone Albania is the second national mobile telephone operator in Albania. The company was established in 2001 after winning a license as part of a fair and transparent bidding process. The company is rapidly expanding its subscriber base and coverage area. The greenfield project represents the full 5 year investment program (2001-2005) for the establishment and operation of the second nationwide mobile telephone network offering various services, including but not limited to GSM cellular services and leased fixed lines to enterprises.
IFC's role in the project includes: supporting the liberalization and private sector development of the telecom sector. encouraging healthy competition in the cellular market in Albania. This will result in: lower tariffs; improved quality of service and customer responsiveness; expanded access to telecommunication services, and introduction of new services.
Development Impact: Given Albania's low telecom penetration rates (6.8% for fixed line), the venture would fulfill substantial unmet demand for reliable telecommunications services and thereby support economic growth. It would also support competition in a previously monopolized mobile market which would result in lower tariffs and the introduction of new value added services for consumers.

mailing-address.narrative: Ms. Evis Karandrea Zayed Business Center Sulejman Delvina Street Tirana, Albania Phone: 355-4-283036 Fax: 355-4-283338

name.narrative: The project consists of the nationwide expansion and upgrade of the second GSM network in Albania by Vodafone Albania. Vodafone Albania is expanding from a base in Albania's largest cities including Tirana and Dures, and expects to cover 95% of the population by 2005.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
